title: Wellington Albert
text:
Wellington Albert (born 3 September 1994) is a <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a>n <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a for the <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the <a href="Betfred%20Championship">Championship</a> in England and <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> at international level.
He previously played for the <a href="North%20Wales%20Crusaders">North Wales Crusaders</a>, <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a>, <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a>, <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes Vikings</a> and <a href="Keighley%20Cougars">Keighley Cougars</a>.
Background.
Albert was born in <a href="Mendi">Mendi</a>, <a href="Southern%20Highlands%20Province">Southern Highlands</a> in <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a>. He is the elder brother of fellow PNG international <a href="Stanton%20Albert">Stanton Albert</a>.
Playing career.
Mendi Muruks.
He played for the <a href="Mendi%20Muruks">Mendi Muruks</a> and the <a href="Lae%20Snax%20Tigers">Lae Snax Tigers</a> in the <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20National%20Rugby%20League">PNGNRL</a> before being selected to represent Papua New Guinea at the <a href="2013%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2013 World Cup</a>.
PNG Hunters.
On 12 December 2013, Albert was named in the <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20Hunters">Papua New Guinea Hunters</a>' squad for their inaugural 2014 season in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>, though he later signed a two-year deal with the <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith Panthers</a> starting in 2014. He was the second Papua New Guinean player to be signed by an NRL club without having played junior rugby league in Australia.
Albert played 5 games for the Panthers' <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team in 2014 before suffering a season-ending shoulder injury. In 2015, Albert moved into the Panthers' <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Cup">NSW Cup</a> team.
Keighley Cougars.
At the end of the 2020 championship Albert joined League 1 team, <a href="Keighley%20Cougars">Keighley Cougars</a> Prior to the start of the 2021 season he suffered a serious ankle injury in training which prevented him playing at all in 2021.
London Broncos.
On 3 Nov 2021 it was reported that he had signed for <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">RFL Championship</a>
International Career.
He played for the Kumuls in their pre-tournament match against <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Scotland</a>, where he scored a try. His only match of the tournament was against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> on 8 November 2013, where he again scored a try.
On 2 May 2015, he represented Papua New Guinea in the <a href="Pacific%20Rugby%20League%20International%23Melanesian%20Cup">2015 Melanesian Cup</a> against <a href="Fiji%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Fiji</a>.
Personal life.
In 2014, Albert started an economics degree at the <a href="University%20of%20Western%20Sydney">University of Western Sydney</a>. His brother <a href="Stanton%20Albert">Stanton</a> has returned to Papua New Guinea from England to play for the <a href="PNG%20Hunters">PNG Hunters</a> team in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> in 2018.
